newsitem.title: LEBANON: Police club Beirut demonstrators - witness.
newsitem.headline: Police club Beirut demonstrators - witness.

text.p: Lebanese riot police clubbed protesters during a general strike in Beirut on Thursday as they tried to gather for a demonstration against the government.
A Reuters reporter saw about 50 police with helmets, riot shields and clubs approach a group of 30 protesters and order them to leave the assembly point for the demonstration. They then clubbed them.
The group of demonstrators, who included labour leaders, political party leaders and prominent leftist parliamentary deputy Zaher al-Khateeb, fled down sidestreets.
The Reuters reporter saw police arrest at least three people. The rest joined other groups of protesters and turned to chant "Bread, education, freedom" at the police.
About 500 demonstrators taunted the police from sidestreets, waving a banner saying: "Lebanon will not be turned into a prison like the Bastille".

Earlier, 200 soldiers and 100 policemen flooded the assembly point in the Barbir area -- beside Beirut's former civil war Green Line battlefront -- as protesters began arriving for the demonstration against the policies of billionaire Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri.
They ordered demonstrators who arrived in small groups to move on before a crowd could gather.
